title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.46 - Executive Order No. 46: Naming the State Office Building Campus in Albany the Governor W. Averell Harriman State Office Building Campus
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.46 - Executive Order No. 46: Naming the State Office Building Campus in Albany the Governor W. Averell Harriman State Office Building Campus

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the master plan for the office complex known as
the State Office Building Campus located in the western part of the City of

Albany, was commissioned, and construction pursuant to the master plan was
authorized and implemented, by Governor W. Averell Harriman; and
WHEREAS, the State Office Building Campus constitutes a
major center of New York State government operations, where creative
architecture and natural beauty have been combined to express simultaneously
the dignity of the State and a subtle sensitivity to the scale of the
individual human being, while providing a pleasant, efficient working
environment for State employees; and
WHEREAS, the State Office Building Campus is a living
legacy of the leadership and vision which characterized the administration of

Governor W. Averell Harriman, and a fitting tribute to his career in service to
his State, the nation and the world which spans more than seven decades: NOW, THEREFORE, I, Mario M. Cuomo, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and laws
of the State of New York, do hereby proclaim and direct that the State Office

Building Campus in the City of Albany shall hereafter be known as the Governor
W. Averell Harriman State Office Building Campus. The Commissioner of General Services, charged with the
superintendence and management thereof, shall cause to be established and
erected in an appropriate location within the Governor W. Averell Harriman

State Office Building Campus a suitable permanent marker and plaque and other
commemorative improvements, to memorialize the extraordinary public
achievements and the unique benefits imparted to the People of the State of New

York by the distinguished services of Governor W. Averell Harriman. Signed: Mario M. Cuomo

Dated: August 28, 1984
